clans.name: Kadem
clans.description: Jok'Jok folks. Adem was the son of Onyango Rabala, who had three wives: Anyango Dhiaga (Nyamwa), Akumu (mother of Owiti/Bwoch), and Nyagone (mother of Adem). Sub clans in Kadem include Kanyuor, Kanyaruanda, Kakoth, and Kolal. Adem married and had a son Nyadera, whose wives formed sub clans Akoth, Anyuor, and Okal. Nyamanda, a sub clan, was wife of Nyakuji, son of Owiti. After Nyakuji died, Adem took Nyaruanda. Kadem, Karungu, Kabwoch, and Kanyamwa are Joka-Onyango Rabala groups.

clans.name: Karungu
clans.description: Joka Jok folks. Name originated from Mirungu Nyosire, elder wife of Biu, son of Onyango Rabala. Biu had seven wives: Mirungu, Pany, Tuda, Nyomiro, Achuku, Akumu, Achieng', and Nyasam. Mirungu influenced Achuku and Achieng' and broke away with Kadem from Kanyamwa to settle in Sori. Karungu sub-locations include Kachuku, Nyasaa, Kachieng', and Nyosire.

clans.name: Kamagambo
clans.description: Population descended from Kasimba whose mother was Nyangare and father Miserma. Kasimba had two wives: Magambo (elder) and Nyamita. Magambo bore Wambi and Nyawanga; Nyamita bore Mwango and Kakrao. Sub clans named after Kasimba's grandchildren. Nyawanga married Nyamamba, Wambi Rabala, and Ngeso. Nyamamba's family formed sub-clans: Kamtwe, Kamreri, Kadhudha, Kawino, Kamsumba, and Kangeso (in Kanyamamba). Ngeso was Nyawanga's third wife. Wambo's son Nyandiga had three wives, forming sub clans: Kongudi, Kongoma, Koluoch, Kabuoro, Kagoro. Nyandiga's daughter Mbija married Waora forming Kambija sub-clan. Kasimba's sons: Nyawanga, Nyandiga, Owuor, Nyargure. Clans include Kanyamamba, Kanyandiga, Kanyajuok, and Kamwango.

clans.name: Kanyamkago
clans.description: No specific details provided in the source but is a known clan in Migori.
